results.content: I am very new to AngularJS and would be interested to know what a module, controller and view is exactly. I felt that without knowing the basics the lecture jumps into the explaining the program using controllers, functions etc.

results.content:
I am using this as a refresher course.  I worked with AngularJS about 3 years ago on one project.  The material and the instructor are great.

The transcript has some real problems.  The text does not match the instructor's words.  Like it was transcribed by a machine, not a human.

results.content: There is no flow  in the course.  And the explanations are terrible.

response.content:
There is certainly a proper flow in the course and other reviews are proof of it. 
If you take a look at the curriculum it clearly shows how well formed it is

We start with 

Section 1: Introduction to AngularJS

What is AngularJS

Why one should use AngularJS

Basics of AngularJS

AngularJS Architecture Pattern

Section 2: Understanding Views,Directives & Filters
Introduction

One way Data Binding 

Two Way Data Binding 

Directives & Expressions 

Built-in Directives 

Iterating over data 

Sorting & Formatting Data 

Making use of ng-include

Section 3: Modules,Controllers & Scope

Understanding Modules

Defining & Adding a Controller to a Module

Hooking Views to Controller

Module,Controller and Views in action - Code Demo

Dealing with minification & Parameter Injection techniques

Section 4: Forms,Models & Validatons

Preparing our Form

Posting our reviews back to our review collection

Form Validation in action

Section 5: Templates - Custom Directives

Custom Directives & their types

Custom Directives with Controllers

Section 6: Routing

Introduction to Routing

Making use of ngRoute

Configuring routes using $routeProvider & ng-view Directive

Configuring Additional routes with parameters

Section 7: Factories & Services

Not only this we have developed a full website using angular js which gives students hands on experience of how to use Angular in real world.

We can see that you have just finished 25% of the course and gave this review which clearly shows that you have not completed the course. Our request would be to please complete the course and then do the review. 

Even if that does not helps then we are sorry to find out that you did not liked the course, if you are under 30 days refund period we would request you to please ask for refund.

Best Regards,
SkillBakery Team
